title: Morrisons in Sunderland and Shildon set to close amid cost-cutting plans
content:
The Castletown store in Sunderland and Shildon store in County Durham are among 11 which have been earmarked for…  
Supermarket giant Morrisons is set to close two stores in the North East as part of plans to shut 11 struggling stores. 

Stores in Shildon, County Durham and Castletown in Sunderland are among the affected stores to close as part of its turnaround plan, it has been reported. 

The remaining stores earmarked to close include two in Somerset, two in Greater Manchester, one in Northallerton, North Yorkshire, and two in the West Midlands. 

The move puts 900 jobs at risk and come after a significant slump in profits. 

Pre-tax profits for the six months to August 2 2015 fell 47% to £126m, while like-for-like sales for the period dropped 2.7% compared with the same period last year. 

At the time of the announcement, new chief executive David Potts said the group faced a “long journey” to turn around its fortunes.
